Performing Preview Operations

View Manager allows you to preview the results of your synchronization operation by selecting the Preview tab from the lower pane.

Previews can be displayed only when objects of the same type have been selected from both the source and target panes. Before viewing a preview, you must specify the type of synchronization desired (source-to-target, bidirectional, or missing-objects-only) and a set of options.

When the Preview tab is selected, a composite tree appears in the lower pane. The status of each object in the tree indicates what would have happened if the operation had not been a preview.

You can search the preview results to find differences, unresolved files, and locked files. If you double-click a pair of unresolved text files, the comparison utility allows you see the differences or conflicts in the files. However, you cannot resolve file differences or conflicts except during an actual run.

To run a preview operation:

  1. From View Manager, select the source and target objects. See Selecting Source and Target Objects.

  2. Select the options for the operation you want to perform. See Selecting View Manager Options.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Select  Run > Preview > Source to Target, Run > Preview  > Bidirectional, or Run > Preview > Missing Objects Only from the menu bar.

    • Click the Preview: Source-to-Target button, Preview: Bidirectional button, or Preview: Missing-Objects-Only button on the toolbar.

    Note: Previews cannot be run for copy-to-target operations.

  4. Review the confirmation dialog, which reminds you not to run View Manager without making current server backups. Although a preview operation does not make any changes to either server, you should prepare for subsequent run operations.

  5. Click Review Options to review your current option settings, to be certain that you have made the correct choices.

  6. Click Run. Progress bars appear.

  7. Examine the data in the Preview plane to assess what would happen with your current selections. For example, you may want to reset some options to obtain different results.

After a preview operation, it is recommended that you search for locked files. Then you can notify the users to unlock the files before you begin the actual synchronization or copy operation.

To find locked files:

    Do one of the following:

    • Select Find > Next Locked File or Find > Previous Locked File from the menu bar.

    • Click the Find Next Locked File button or the Find Previous Locked File button on the toolbar.
